title: Prison staff find serial killer Levi Bellfield 'minutes from death' after making suicide bid
text:
Serial killer Levi Bellfield was just ‘minutes from death’ after making an apparent suicide bid, it was reported last night

Serial killer Levi Bellfield was just ‘minutes from death’ after making an apparent suicide bid, it was reported last night.

Bellfield, 51, who was jailed for three murders, including that of schoolgirl Milly Dowler, was found by staff seriously hurt in his cell at the maximum-security Frankland prison in Co Durham on Friday.

‘If prison officers hadn’t been on hand so swiftly, he would have died,’ a source told The Sun on Sunday.

The former nightclub bouncer, who is reported to now be on a round-the-clock watch, murdered 13-year-old Milly in March 2002 after abducting her in Walton-on-Thames, Surrey.

The teenager went missing while making her way home from school and her body was found in a wood six months later.

Bellfield went on to kill Marsha McDonnell, 19, and Amelie Delagrange, 22. He is also suspected of other killings.

Bellfield is serving a whole life term at Frankland, where fellow inmates include Yorkshire Ripper Peter Sutcliffe and Soham murderer Ian Huntley.

A Ministry of Justice spokesman declined to comment last night.
